lines.content: This file records my use of AI tools during the development of this project.
- Helped me refactor my `Ui` class to use **StringBuilder** instead of repeated string concatenation (improved efficiency).
- Guided me on **OOP design choices**, such as whether to use a single `showMessage(String msg)` method vs. keeping specialized methods, and recommended a middle-ground approach.
- Suggested improvements like extracting **constant messages into `static final` fields** for cleaner, reusable code.
- Guided me on how to validate that an Event's end time is later than its start time using LocalDateTime.isAfter
- The AI was helpful in catching **consistency issues** (extra newlines, pluralization, formatting).
- The explanations about trade-offs (clarity vs. simplicity) were especially useful for making design decisions.
- Clarified that comparing datetime string directly is unreliable, and that LocalDateTIme comparison is correct.
- Saved me about **1–2 hours** compared to figuring these improvements out alone.
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Waz_. Given below are
instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Waz.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Waz.main()` (if the code
editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

>  "Your mind is for having ideas, not holding them." - David Allen
Meet **Waz**, a friendly text-based chatbot that helps you managed your tasks with ease.
It's simple, fast and ~~stressful~~ STRESS-FREE to use!
- Add events with date and time
- Add deadlines with date and time ⏰
- Mark and unmark tasks as done ✅
All commands are case insensitive. Index refers to the task number shown in the displayed list.
Safely shut down the app. (auto-saves before exit).
Show a list of a tasks
- `list` - show all tasks with their indexes.
Add a task with no deadlines
- `todo study math` - Adds a to-do task named "study math".
Schedule events with start and end times.
## ❌ Unmark a Task as Not Done
Unmark a task as not completed.
- `unmark 1` - Unmark the 1st task as not completed.
Every change made is automatically saved into your disk.
* The {@code Waz} class represent the main chatbot application that manages tasks.
* Waz allows the user to add todos, events, and deadlines, mark tasks as done,
* unmark tasks, delete tasks, search for tasks, and exit the program by typing "bye".
* It handles user input, parses commands, executes them, and interacts with storage and UI.
* Initialises the Ui, storage, and loads task from the file
* Generates a response for the user's chat message.
* Represents a command to add {@link Deadline} task to the task list
*     When executed, this command validates the input description, start time and end time. Creates a new Deadline task
*     and adds it to the {@link TaskList}, updates the Ui, save the updated list to storage.
* Constructs an AddDeadlineCommand with the given task description, deadline
* @param commandInput the description of the Deadline task
* Executes the command by creating a Deadline task and adding it to the task list.
*     The method also updates the Ui to show the newly added task and persists the updated list to the storage file
* @param ui the Ui to show feedback to the user
* @param storage the storage to save the updated task list
* @throws WazException if the description, /by parts are missing or empty
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws WazException {
assert commandParts.length == 2 && !commandParts[1].trim().isEmpty() : "Deadline should not be empty";
if (isDescriptionEmpty) { // Check if description is empty
throw new WazException("A deadline task needs a description!");
} else if (isDeadlineMissing) { // Check if /by is missing or deadline is empty
throw new WazException("A deadline task needs a deadline!");
Task deadlineTask = new Deadline(description, deadline); // task name, deadline by...
* Represents a command to add {@link Event} task to the task list

* @param storage the storage to save the updated task list

public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws WazException {
if (isDescriptionEmpty) { // Check if /from is missing or description is empty
throw new WazException("A event task needs a description!");
throw new WazException("A event task must include /from and /to!");
String[] time = commandParts[1].split("/to", 2); // from and to
boolean isTimeEmpty = time.length < 2 || isStartTimeEmpty || time[1].trim().isEmpty(); // Check start & end time
// Check if /to is missing or description empty
throw new WazException("A event task must include /from and /to!");
Task eventTask = new Event(description, startTime, endTime);
